# Draft:Historical museum of Suor Orsola Benincasa Institute

The Historical Museum of Suor Orsola Benincasa Institute is a museum in Naples, inaugurated in 2004 and located within the Institute complex, specifically in the former parlor of the monastery.
Inside it houses paintings and other artistic objects from the monastery's heritage and the legacy of Adelaide del Balzo Pignatelli, who promoted the transition of the secular educational institution towards the modern secular institute of culture that later became the University "Suor Orsola Benincasa University of Naples".
Among the most important paintings are the "Road to Calvary" attributed to Jusepe de Ribera and his school, the sixteenth-century panel of the "Immaculate Conception" by Girolamo Imperato, the life-size "Christ Deposed" by Giacomo Colombo. There are also devotional objects, jewelry, and many portraits of Princess Adelaide del Balzo.
